meanings.sent1: She was discountenancing the idea of skipping school.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was discountenancing cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sad eyes discountenanced any scolding from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds discountenanced our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: His stern look discountenanced any further discussion on the matter.

meanings.definition: To show disapproval or disfavor towards
meanings.sent1: The mayor was discountenancing the proposal for a new tax.
meanings.sent2: The audience was discountenancing the rude behavior of the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The cat discountenanced the new dog in the house by hissing.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds discountenanced the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: Her raised eyebrow discountenanced any further interruptions during the meeting.

meanings.definition: To discourage or prevent by disapproval
meanings.sent1: The warning signs were discountenancing trespassers from entering the property.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules were discountenancing any form of misbehavior.
meanings.sent3: The loud alarm discountenanced any attempts at theft.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate discountenanced any unauthorized access.
meanings.sent5: The fierce guard dog discountenanced any intruders from approaching the house.
